episode_title: 114 - The One With the Candy Hearts

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is eyeing a beautiful woman at the counter, and Joey and Chandler are egging him on to go talk to her. No pun intended. I mean it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m tellin’ you Ross, she wants you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She barely knows me. We just live in the same building.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Any contact?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She lent me an egg once.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re in!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw, right.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. (stutters something incoherent)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, Ross, you gotta get back in the game here, ok? The Rachel thing’s not happening, your ex-wife is a lesbian—I don’t think we need a third…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excuse me, could we get an egg over here, still in the shell? Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: An egg?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you’re gonna go up to her and say, “Here’s your egg back, I’m returning your egg.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think it’s winning.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think it’s insane.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’ll love it. Go with the egg, my friend.
(Ross walks over to the woman, egg in hand.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Think it’ll work?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it’s suicide. The man’s got an egg.

content.description: Opening Credits
Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler are there. Ross is still talking to the beautiful woman.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can not do this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do what, do what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Roger wants to take her out tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Phoebes! Don’t you remember why you dumped the guy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ’Cause he was creepy, and mean, and a little frightening… alright, still, it’s nice to have a date on Valentine’s Day!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But Phoebe, you can go out with a creepy guy any night of the year. I know I do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what are you guys doing tomorrow night?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Actually, tomorrow night kinda depends on how tonight goes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uh, listen, about tonight…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, don’t you dare bail on me. The only reason she’s goin’ out with me is because I said I could bring a friend for her friend.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I know, but her friend sounds like such a…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pathetic mess? I know, but—come on, man, she’s needy, she’s vulnerable. I’m thinkin’, cha-ching! (Rachel throws a roll at Joey. He picks it up and eats it.) Thanks. Look, you have not been out with a woman since Janice. You’re doin’ this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. She said yes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Way to go, man! (Chandler and Ross hug. Something crunches in Ross’ shirt pocket.) Still got the egg, huh?

content.description: A Restaurant, Joey and Chandler are there, waiting for their dates to show up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How do I look?
content.parenthetical: Looking at himself in the reflection on a knife

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uh, I… don’t… care. (Joey’s date shows up) Ok, now, remember, no trading. You get the pretty one, I get the mess.

content.speaker: Lorraine
content.text: Hi, Joey. Well well, look what you brought. Very nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …And what did you bring?

content.speaker: Lorraine
content.text: She’s checking the coats. Joey, I’m gonna go wash the cab smell off my hands. Will you get me a white Zinfandel, and a glass of red for Janice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice?
(Lorraine leaves. Joey shakes his head as though to say, ‘It can’t be the same Janice.’ Janice enters.)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh… my… God.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, it’s Janice.

content.description: The bathroom at the restaurant, Chandler and Joey are talking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, I’m makin’ a break for it, I’m goin’ out the window.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, don’t! I’ve been waitin’ for like, forever to go out with Lorraine. Just calm down.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Calm down? Calm down? You set me up with the woman that I’ve dumped twice in the last five months!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can you stop yellin’? You’re makin’ me nervous, and I can’t go when I’m nervous.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m sorry, you’re right. (gets up right behind Joey and yells in his ear) Come on, do it, do it, go, come on!!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the girls are all there, discussing their bad luck with men.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, ok, Roger was creepy, but he was nothing compared to Pete Carney.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Which one was Pete Carney?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pete the Weeper? Remember that guy who used to cry every time we had sex. (imitating) “Was it good for you?”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well, I’ll take a little crying any day over Howard-the-”I-win”-guy. (imitating) “I win! I win!” I went out with the guy for two months—I didn’t get to win once.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How did we end up with these jerks? We’re good people!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know. Maybe we’re some kinda magnets.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know I am. That’s why I can’t wear a digital watch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s more beer, right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! You know my friend Abby who shaves her head? She said that if you want to break the bad boyfriend cycle, you can do like a cleansing ritual.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebes, this woman is voluntarily bald.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. So, we can do it tomorrow night, you guys. It’s Valentine’s Day. It’s perfect.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, well, what kind of ritual?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok. We can, um, we can burn the stuff they gave us.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Or?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or…or we can chant and dance around naked, you know, with sticks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Burning’s good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Burning’s good. Yeah, I got stuff to burn.

content.description: The Restaurant, Joey, Lorraine, Chandler, and Janice are at the table. Joey and Lorraine are seated very close, Chandler and Janice have backed their chairs away from one another.

content.speaker: Lorraine
content.text: You know, ever since I was little, I’ve been able to pick up quarters with my toes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good for you. (jumps suddenly) Uh, quarters or rolls of quarters?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: By the way, Chandler. I cut you out of all my pictures. So if you want, I have a bag with just your heads.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s OK.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, are you sure? Really? Because you know, you could make little puppets out of them, and you could use them in your theater of cruelty.
(Lorraine whispers into Joey’s ear.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We can’t do that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? What can’t you do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, can I talk to you for a second, over there?
(Chandler and Joey leave the table.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, we might be leaving now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tell me it’s “you and me” we.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She said she wants to slather my body with stuff and then lick it off. I’m not even sure what slathering is, but I definitely want to be a part of it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, you can not do this to me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re right, I’m sorry. You’re right.

content.speaker: Lorraine
content.text: Uh, can we have three chocolate mousses to go please?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m outta here. Here’s my credit card. Dinner’s on me. I’m sorry, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I hope she throws up on you.
(Joey leaves with Lorraine. Chandler sits back down with Janice.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Just us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, what a crappy night!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Although, I have enjoyed the fact that, uh your shirt’s been stickin’ outta your zipper ever since you came back from the bathroom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me. (gets up, jumps up and down while he zips his zipper up… other patrons look at him) How ya doin’?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: So, do we have the best friends or what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey’s not a friend. He’s…a stupid man who left us his credit card. Another drink? Some dessert? A big screen TV?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I will go for that drink.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got it. Good woman! (the waiter turns around, it’s a man) Could we get a bottle of your most overpriced champagne?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Each.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right, each. Oh, and a uh Rob Roy. (to Janice) I’ve always wanted to know…

content.description: Chandler’s bedroom, Chandler wakes up, and finds someone else’s hand on his chest. He rolls over and is shocked to see Janice there.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Happy Valentine’s Day!

content.description: Commercial Break
The Hallway, Chandler is trying to get Janice out of his apartment.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, I miss you already. Can you believe this happened?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No… no! And yet it did. Good-bye, Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Kiss me!
(Janice kisses him. Monica comes out for the newspaper.}

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Chandler, sorry.
(Janice turns around, Monica sees who it is.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhh, Chandler, sorry! Hey, Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Hi, Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, well, this was very special.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, come see who’s out here!
(Rachel comes out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god. Janice, hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice is gonna go away now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll be right back.
(Joey enters from the stairs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Joey, look who it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, good, Joey’s home now.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: This is so fun. This is like a reunion in the hall.
(Monica comes out with her cordless phone.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, hi, Ross. Yeah. There’s someone I want you to say hi to. (to Chandler) He just happened to call.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Hi, Ross. Yes, it’s me. How did you know? (she laughs obnoxiously)

content.description: A Chinese Restaurant, Ross is there with his date.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m just sayin’ if dogs do experience jet lag, then, because of the whole um, seven dog years to one human year thing, then, when a dog flies from New York to Los Angeles, he doesn’t just lose three hours, he loses like a week and a half.
(Ross starts to laugh, and then makes a face like ‘Why did I just say that?’ Ross’ ex-wife, Carol, and her lesbian lover, Susan, enter the restaurant. Ross stares at them.)

content.speaker: Kristin
content.text: That’s funny. Who are they?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The blond woman is my ex-wife, and the woman touching her is her… close, personal friend.

content.speaker: Kristin
content.text: You mean they’re lovers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: If you wanna put a label on it.

content.speaker: Kristin
content.text: Wow, uh, anything else I should know?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nope, nope, that’s it.
(Carol takes off her jacket, her pregnant belly is exposed.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, and she’s pregnant with my baby. I always forget that part. (to Carol and Susan) Helloo!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the girls are holding their boyfriend bonfire.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, so now we need, um sage branches and the sacramental wine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All I have is, is oregano and a Fresca .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, that’s ok! (throws it in fire) Ok. All right. Now we need the semen of a righteous man.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Pheebs, you know what, if we had that, we wouldn’t be doing the ritual in the first place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can we just start throwing things in?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, yeah, ok. (she throws the directions in) Oh, OK.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Barry’s letters. Adam Ritter’s boxer shorts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, and I have the, uh receipt for my dinner with Nokululu Oon Ah Ah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, here’s a picture of Scotty Jared naked.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey he’s wearing a sweater.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel and Phoebe
content.text: Eww!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And here we have the last of Paulo’s grappa.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Rachel, isn’t that stuff almost pure…
(Rachel throws the alcohol in the fire. A burst of flames shoots up from it.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are there. Chandler is preparing to dump Janice again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How can I dump this woman on Valentine’s day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. You dumped her on New Year’s.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, man. In my next life, I’m coming back as a toilet brush.
(Janice enters.)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Hello, funny Valentine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, Just Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Hello, Joey, our little matchmaker. I could just kiss you all over, and I’m gonna!
(Janice kisses Joey all over. Chandler smiles.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you don’t do it, I will.

content.description: The Chinese Restaurant.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, um, what do you do for a living?

content.speaker: Kristin
content.text: Well, um, for the past few years I’ve been working..(Ross is watching Carol and Susan, not listening to Kristin. Susan gets up, and has to go. Carol is left stranded)…which is funny because, that wasn’t even my major.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh no. I thought you said they could shoot the spot without you.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I thought they could…I’ll try to get back as soon as I can. I’m sorry. (Ross realizes Kristin was expecting him to laugh, so he starts to laugh hysterically.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now that is funny. Hey, do you think…would it be too weird if I invited Carol over to join us? ’Cause she’s, she’s alone now, and pregnant, and, and sad.

content.speaker: Kristin
content.text: I guess.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you sure? Great. Carol? Wanna come over and join us?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh, no no no. I’m fine. I’m fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on. These people’ll scooch down. You guys’ll scooch, won’t you? Let’s try scooching! Come on. Come on. Uh, Kristen Riggs, this is Carol Willick. Carol, Kristin. Uh, Carol teaches sixth grade. And, Kristin, Kristin…(struggling)…does something that, funnily enough, wasn’t even her major!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, firemen are there to handle the bonfire that got out of control.

content.speaker: Fireman No. 1
content.text: What do we got there?

content.speaker: Fireman No. 2
content.text: A piece of something: boxer shorts, greeting cards, and what looks like a half-charred picture—Wow, that guy’s hairier than the Chief!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, it’s a really funny story how this happened.

content.speaker: Fireman No. 3
content.text: It’s all right. It’s all right. You don’t have to explain. This isn’t the first boyfriend bonfire that we’ve seen get out of control.

content.speaker: Fireman No. 1
content.text: You’re our third call tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Fireman No. 2
content.text: Oh, sure, Valentine’s is our busiest night of the year.

content.description: Central Perk.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I brought you something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is it loaded? Oh, little candy hearts. (reading the candy) Chan and Jan Forever.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I had them made special.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, Janice. Janice. Hey, Janice. Look, there’s no way for me to tell you this. At least there’s no new way for me to tell you this. I just don’t things are gonna work out.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: That’s fine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Mmm-hmm. Because I know that this isn’t the end.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no, you see, actually it is.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: No, it isn’t, because you won’t let that happen. Don’t you know it yet? You love me, Chandler Bing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no I don’t.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Well then ask yourself this. Why do you think we keep ending up together? New Year’s? Who invited who? Valentine’s? Who asked who into whose bed?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I did, but…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: You seek me out. Something deep in your soul calls out to me like a foghorn. Janice, Janice. You want me. You need me. You can’t live without me. And you know it. You just don’t know you know it. See ya.
(She kisses him passionately,then leaves.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Call me!

content.description: The Chinese Restaurant, Ross and Carol are talking. Kristin is not there.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: It’s not true. I never called your mother a wolverine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You did so. I swear, I swear—(noticing Kristin’s absence) How long has she been in the bathroom?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Uh, I don’t think she’s in the bathroom. Her coat is gone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well maybe it’s cold in there. Or maybe I screwed up the first date I had in 9 years.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: That could be it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, god. (He puts his head down on the grill) You know, this is still pretty hot. (He picks his head up, and a mushroom sticks to his head. Carol picks it off and eats it.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Mushroom. Smile. They won’t all be like this. Some women might even stay through dinner. Sorry, that’s not funny

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s just…you know the whole “getting on with your life” thing. Well, do I have to? I mean, I’m sitting here with this cute woman, and, and, and she’s perfectly nice, and, but that there’s, that’s it. And um, and then I’m here talkin’ to you, and, and it’s easy, and it’s fun, and, and I don’t, I don’t have to…You know, here’s a wacky thought. Um, what’s say you and I give it another shot? No no no, I know what you’re gonna say, you’re a lesbian. But what do you say we just put that aside for now you know? Let’s just stick a pin in it, ok? Because, we’re great together, you know. You can’t deny it. Besides, you’re carrying my baby. I mean, how perfect is that? But see, you know, you keep sayin’ that, but there’s somethin’ right here. I love you.
(They kiss.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh, I love you too. But…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No but, no but.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: You know that thing you put over here with the pin in it? It’s time to take the pin out. You’ll find someone, I know you will. The right woman is just waiting for you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s easy for you to say, you found one already.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: All you need is a woman who likes men and you’ll be set.
(A beautiful woman walks by Ross, he stares at her.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Not her.

content.description: Closing Credits
Monica and Rachel’s, The girls are talking with the firemen.

content.speaker: Fireman No. 3
content.text: We get off around midnight, why don’t we pick you up then?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, um, will you bring the truck?

content.speaker: Fireman No. 3
content.text: I’ll even let you ring the bell.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, my god.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See, there you go, the cleansing works!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’re nice guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, they’re firemen guys.

content.description: Out in the hall, the firemen are talking.

content.speaker: Fireman No. 1
content.text: You guys tell them you were married?

content.speaker: Fireman No. 2
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Fireman No. 3
content.text: Are you kidding? My girlfriend doesn’t know, I’m not gonna tell them!
